title: Training A New Summoner
body:
Hey Guys and Gals!

I need some help, I have played LoL for several years on and off now, and I generally get fairly absorbed in it when I am playing. This caused issues with my gf who couldn't understand how I could get so caught up in it.

My solution? Introduce her to the game.

This worked well, she is a gamer and so far has enjoyed playing with me and my friends on our smurfs, however I realise I have no idea how to teach her how to play, it has just become second nature to me.

So my questions to everyone here is: What made you a better player? What do you wish someone had of shown you when you first started? What is the best way to teach players new to MOBA's the skills to play these types of games?

Thanks in advance to anyone who takes the time to reply!

-nightang3L

replies.body: i can say,simply playing the game..practice practice practice..however...the best way to learn is to watch experts in motion...go watch some pro games and have a research session with her,work around a champ they like,perhaps one that has good skill shots..learning to how to move,where to place your mouse,how to anticipate and read the map for players to strategize..
make her main the no skill support champions or lux

lux isn't no skill, a bad lux can miss 100% of her skillshots and be less useful than a full ap zed. Haven't you learnt anything from seeing all these people spamming lux because of the elementalist skin and then feeding?

Re read.

all the no skill support champions AND lux

as in lux is a weeaboo girl champion

I love when you're doing well as Lux and then people on the enemy team start flaming you for playing an easy champion.
"I hope you don't feel proud of that, all you did was press R."

Then you click tab and none of them have MR.


;)

Depends what rank you are and if you know anything about lane management/proper warding/rotation etc, if your bronze 5 and can't teach her any of that I suggest you check out these:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLyCEt27AsZuvNu0RQiCwgV2j3tR4foqvI

it might also help to have her learn champions that encourage learning the game, champions such as {{champion:33}} jg for learning map presence and how to gank, {{champion:15}} helps you learn attack moving and how to follow up on an engage, {{champion:105}} I feel this is kinda the best champion to learn melee assassins and is a great champion to master, {{champion:37}} support helps you learn positioning and is solid and not incredibly difficult to play, {{champion:78}} is a solid toplaner for most new players, has a bit of everying, delayed aoe q, an antiengage, a dash with terrain interactions, windup disengage ult and a managable passive shield, poppy also teaches some great teamplay. Also since these champions aren't mechanically difficult, they will give her alot more time to watch the map and also learn how to flash and use summoners and item actives. Especially rammus, he can easily farm without even looking at the jungle camps and all these champions are kinda easy to play without locked screen due to having windup skillshots (sivir q, fizz ult, Son ult, Poppy ult).

Congrats and goodluck with your gf, hope you two become the best duo ever.
